metadata.synopsis: Taylor Brooks (Michael Biehn) and his friend Harold Jameson (Matt Craven) are avid mountain climbers. A chance encounter with billionaire adventurer Phillip Claiborne (Raymond J. Barry) lands them two spots on his next expedition: an ascent of K2, the second-highest mountain in the world. It is also one of the deadliest mountains in the world, and as Taylor and Harold begin their climb to the peak, the team starts to worry that the two might not be up to the challenge.

reviews: With its incredible panoramas of snowy peaks, and convincing stunt work at what seems to be a very high altitude, K2 makes an entertaining enough travelogue.
Forget about climbing the mountain, I found it difficult enough just sitting through this film.
A well-photographed and handsome litany of cliche and stereotype.
Manages to provide several credible answers to the famous and oft-asked question-why climb mountains?
K2 serves as an anthology of almost all the obligatory plot points that make mountain climbing movies so predictable.
